etymology.description: semantic 疒(疒) (chuáng, "disease") + phonetic 尤(尤) (yóu) = representative of disease-related condition -> wart
etymology.interpretation: The character 疣(yóu) links the semantic component 疒(疒) to suggest a disease or ailment, with the phonetic 尤(尤) contributing its sound element. This combination fittingly represents 'wart' as a specific medical condition.

examples.chinese: 他的皮肤上长了一个疣(他的皮膚上長了一個疣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de pífū shàng zhǎngle yīgè yóu.
examples.english: He has a wart growing on his skin.

examples.chinese: 医生建议他用药膏(醫生建議他用藥膏)，去除疣(去除疣)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiànyì tā yòng yàogāo, qùchú yóu.
examples.english: The doctor suggested using ointment to remove the wart.

examples.chinese: 中医认为疣与体内湿气有关(中醫認為疣與體內濕氣有關)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyī rènwéi yóu yǔ tǐnèi shīqì yǒuguān.
examples.english: Traditional Chinese medicine believes that warts are related to internal dampness.
